customer_addr:
OFFICE OF RESEARCH INTEGRITY
200 UNIVERSITY OFFICE BUILDING
RIVERSIDE, CA 92521

citations.narrative:
On September 30, 2024, one hummingbird, Ash, died after becoming entangled in its monitoring harness. Records show
on September 12, 2024, Ash got his bill stuck in the neck loop present on this harness design. According to the Principal
Investigator (PI), the harness was removed and replaced. A second hummingbird, Momo, was found on the ground with
his bill stuck in the neck loop on September 28, 2025, and survived the entanglement with no physical injuries or
abrasions noted. The PI stated Ash’s death was reported to the campus veterinarian immediately in September of 2024
and the lab discontinued use of this specific harness design as it was not suitable. Although the approved protocol
addresses measures to ensure the safety of the hummingbirds by conducting weekly checks to assess whether the
harness has any negative effects on birds, at least two birds became entangled in its monitoring harness and likely
experienced behavioral stress and unnecessary discomfort, and one bird, death.
Handling of all animals shall be done as expeditiously and carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma,
overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary discomfort.
To be corrected from this day forward, August 19, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n
